intro: Peplis hyrcanica, commonly known as the Hyrcanian peplis, is a shrub native to Central Asia, particularly found in regions like Iran and Turkmenistan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants known for their umbellate flowers. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Peplis hyrcanica is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in harsh climates.
